patterns: What can you tell me about IIIT Rnchi
What do you know about IIIT Ranchi
Tell me more about IIIT Ranchi
What can you tell me about IIIT Ranchi
What do you know about IIIT Ranchi
Indain institute of information Technology Ranchi
Tell me more about IIIT Ranchi
responses: IIIT Ranchi is An Institute of National importance under MoE, Govt. of India .It is one of the Indian Institute of Information Technology , a Group of 25 Interdisciplinary Technical Universities of Higher education started by Govt. of India

patterns: Give me some facts about IIIT Ranchi
Give me some facts about iiitr
responses: Admissions to undergraduate programs in IIIT Rnachi are done along with the IITs, NITs & IIITs on the basis of the All India Rank in the highly competitive exam (JEE- Main). Seats are filled through Joint Seat Allocation Authority, JOSAA.
Table Mountain in Cape Town is believed to be one of the oldest mountains in the world and one of the planet’s 12 main energy centres, radiating magnetic, electric or spiritual energy.
The IIIT Ranchi is funded by Government of India (50%), Government of Jharkhand (35%) and Industry Partners (15%)
IIIT Ranchi is autonomous, not-for-profit, self-sustaining, teaching and research-led education Institution

IIIT Ranchi will focus on applied research and education in IT and in selected domain areas. IIIT Ranchi will contribute significantly to the global competitiveness of key sectors of the Indian economy and industry.

IN IIIT Ranchi,Academic Programmes are flexible, modular and student centered learning, Project-based learning pedagogy in the curriculum , Industrial practice in curriculum, Best practices for academic excellence and Good governance, Industry oriented curricula and skill development, Strong leadership and good governance , Quality of faculty and faculty development, Support to innovative projects, Students welfare, Green campus

What about Ranchi City? IIIT Ranchi is in Ranchi so I am tellling about it :) Ranchi is the summer capital of Jharkhand, has some of the most scenic cityscapes in India. Popularly referred to as the City of Waterfalls, Ranchi is a beautiful destination full of natural and cultural wonders, with opportunities for trekking through bamboo covered topography and feasting on regional delicacies like ‘Golgappas’, discovering Rabindranath Tagore’s literary sanctuary at Tagore Hill and enjoying the immensity of the Rock Gardens.
IIIT Ranchi will be one of the leading Institutes in India for its academic excellence and good governance

The mission of IIIT Ranchi is :) Academic Excellence and Good Governance, Quest for academic excellence and good governance, Quest for growth of Institute, Quest for most admired and respected Institute for students, employees and Industries, Quest for innovative leader, Quest for economic growth of the nation, Digital and Swachch Institute.

IIIT Ranchi is being mentored by National Institute of Technology, Jamshedpur which has contributed in technical education since year 1960. A land of 52 acres at Ranchi has been allocated for building a new campus and for creating a strong infrastructure, a grant of over Rs 120 crores has been sanctioned by the Central Government, Jharkhand Government and Private Partners

patterns: who is the director of iiit ranchi
What can you tell me about director of  IIIT Rnchi
Tell me about director of IIIT Ranchi
What do you know about IIIT Ranchi director
Tell me more about IIIT Ranchi director
What can you tell me about director
responses: Prof. Vishnu Priye is the director of IIIT Ranchi, From July 20, 2018, Dr Vishnu Priye, has taken over the responsibilities of the first Director of Indian Institute of Information Technology, Ranchi, which was established in year 2016 as an ‘Institute of National Importance under the act of Parliament’. He is on deputation from Indian Institute of Technology (ISM) Dhanbad where he is a Professor in Department of Electronics Engineering.From January 1, 2015 till May 30, 2018, he was Dean (Research & Development) where he played a vital role in the administration. During his period the resource generated from R & D Projects reached about Rs 24 crores. There were more than 20 Memorandum of Understanding (MoUs) signed by him on behalf of the Institute with both National and International Universities and Industries. He was deeply involved with other core members and Director, IIT(ISM) Dhanbad, in bringing out major changes that resulted in conversion of Indian School of Mines Dhanbad into Indian Institute of Technology on September 6, 2017. He became the first Dean (R & D) of IIT(ISM) Dhanbad. For a brief period, he was in additional charge of Dean (Faculty & Planning).He was Head, Department of Electronics Engineering, IIT(ISM) Dhanbad from August 13, 2012 to December 31, 2014 where his main focus was to interact with core industries in electronics.
All India Council for Technical Education

AICTE is an abbreviated form of the All India Council for Technical Education. AICTE is the statutory body and the national-level council for technical education in the country. AICTE was formed in November 1945 with the vision to promote development of the education system in India.
Formation of the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) in 1945 by the Government of India.
The All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) is a statutory body, and a national-level council for technical education, under the Department of Higher Education.

अखिल भारतीय तकनीकी शिक्षा परिषद (AICTE) की स्थापना नवंबर 1945 में एक राष्ट्रीय-स्तर की सर्वोच्च सलाहकार संस्था के रूप में की गई थी, जो तकनीकी शिक्षा के लिए उपलब्ध सुविधाओं पर सर्वेक्षण करने और देश में समन्वित और एकीकृत तरीके से विकास को बढ़ावा देने के लिए बनाई गई थी।.

patterns: what is the mission of aicte
responses: According to the All India Council for Technical Education, 1987, the AICTE is vested with statutory authority for planning, formulation and maintenance of norms and standards, quality assurance through school accreditation, funding in priority areas, monitoring and evaluation, maintaining parity of certification and awards and ensuring coordinated and integrated development and management of technical education in the country.

“To be a world-class organization leading technological and socio-economic development of the country by enhancing the global competitiveness of technical manpower and by ensuring high quality technical education to all sections of the society.

patterns: Where to send the queries related to portal and approval related issues for the approval process 2021-22?
Where to send the questions related to portal and approval related issues for the approval process 2021-22?
Where to send the queries related to portal and approval related issues for the approval process
responses: Institute are requested to raises queries only through online Grievance Redressal mechanism available on AICTE website under Approval Process 2021-22 quick links. No queries through email will be entertained.

patterns: Is it mandatory for an Institution offering Courses in Architecture and Pharmacy to obtain Approval from AICTE?
Institution offering Courses in Architecture and Pharmacy to obtain Approval from AICTE?
responses: In compliance of the order dated 08.11.2019 passed by the Hon’ble Supreme Court of Indian CA No.364/ 2005, for the existing Institutions offering Courses in Architecture Programme, approval by the Council of Architecture (CoA) is mandatory and AICTE approval is NOT required.

patterns: Whether establishment of a new Technical Institution to offer Courses in Engineering and Technology is permissible in Academic Year 2021-22?
new Technical Institution to offer Courses in Engineering and Technology is permissible in Academic Year 2021-22?
new Technical Institution to offer Courses in Engineering and Technology is permissible in Academic Year
responses: The Council shall NOT grant approval to New Technical Institutions at the Diploma/ UnderGraduate/ Post Graduate Level in Engineering and Technology in line with the recommendations of the Committee set up by AICTE to provide National Perspective Plan for Technical Programmes. However, establishment of New Technical Institutions in Engineeringand Technology shall be permitted only in conditions as specified in Chapter I of APH 2021-22.

patterns: Whether AICTE approval is needed for running MCA Course in our Arts and Science College?
running MCA Course in our Arts and Science College?
responses: Yes. Refer Clause 1.3.5 of APH 2021-22. In case of non-Technical Institutions seeking approval for conducting MCA/ MBA and University Departments/ Constituent Colleges seeking approval for conducting MCA/ MBA/ M.Tech. Programmes apart from their existing Courses, separate building and Principal are NOT required. However, in such cases all other norms (as   per   APH   2021-22)  such as separate Head of the Department, Faculty, Infrastructure, Built-Up area, etc. should be fulfilled.

patterns: Whether MCA/ MBA Department of Arts and Science College is eligible to apply for AICTE approval?
Whether MCA/ MBA Department of Arts and Science College is eligible
responses: Yes. Refer Clause 1.3.5 of APH 2021-22. In case of non-Technical Institutions seeking approval for conducting MCA/ MBA and University Departments/ Constituent Colleges seeking approval for conducting MCA/ MBA/ M.Tech. Programmes apart from their existing Courses, separate building and Principal are NOT required. However, in such cases all other norms (as   per   APH   2021-22)  such as separate Head of the Department, Faculty, Infrastructure, Built-Up area, etc. should be fulfilled.

patterns: Can we apply for closure of the existing Institution and open a new Institution at the same premises?
apply for closure of the existing Institution and open a new Institution at the same premises?
responses: Yes. The existing Institution applied for Closure of the Institution are also eligible to apply for starting a new Technical Institution in the same premises in the same Academic year. Technical Institutions applying under this Clause shall have to apply for Progressive/ Complete Closure of the Institution for the existing Programme(s) and shall apply for a different Programme. However, the Applicant has to make Material/ Non-Material amendment of the Building Plan, Site Plan, etc. duly approved by the concerned Competent Authority (if applicable) to suit the requirements of the new Programme. In case of change in Building Plan, the approval of present Competent Authority is required.

patterns: Whether a New Institution is obligated to appoint a Principal and Faculty at the time of application for approval or subsequent to approval before commencement of the Course? Whether the Faculty to be appointed are for the First Year of the Course or for the entire period of the Course?
Whether a New Institution is obligated to appoint a Principal and Faculty at the time of application for approval or subsequent to approval before commencement of the Course?
Whether the Faculty to be appointed are for the First Year of the Course or for the entire period of the Course?

appoint a Principal and Faculty at the time of application for approval or subsequent to approval before commencement of the Course? Whether the Faculty to be appointed are for the First Year of the Course or for the entire period of the Course?
Whether a New Institution is obligated to appoint a Principal and Faculty at the time of application for approval or subsequent to approval before commencement of the Course
responses: The New Institution is obligated to appoint a Principal and Faculty before the commencement of the Course. The Faculty to be appointed are for the First Year of the Course and it will beprogressively done each year so that an Expert Visit Committee (EVC) conducted any time before the first batch of students has passed out, the availability of the facilities of an Institution as per the norms in Approval Process Handbook shall be verified.

patterns: We have got the first approval for our Institution in 2020-21. But we have NOT admitted students due the delay in getting affiliation. Do we need to apply for EoA?
Do we need to apply for EoA?
responses: ALL the applicants issued LoA for starting the New Technical Institutions shall apply on AICTE Web-Portal for Extension of Approval (EOA) as specified in the Approval Process Handbook from the next Academic Year onwards, irrespective of the admission of the students. However, such institutes need to answer one Question related to this on portal inorder to avoid deficiency.

patterns: While applying, I had made a mistake in opting for FN/OCI? How can I rectify the mistake?
How can I rectify the mistake?
We had applied for the Closure of the Institution, but now we have decided to apply for EoA. How can I revert the application?
How can I revert the application?
responses: You can inform AICTE as per the procedure mentioned in Clause 2.3.8 of APH 2021-22.

patterns: Our Institution was given Withdrawal of Approval in 2018-19. We are not able to apply under 2021-22 application.
Our Institution was given Withdrawal of Approval
responses: You have to apply ONLY as a New Institution in 2021-22.

patterns: We have 5 Diploma Courses, Can we apply for conversion of Two Diploma Courses only into Degree Courses?
conversion of Two Diploma Courses only into Degree Courses?
responses: No. Partial conversion of Courses / Programmes at any Levels is NOT permitted.

patterns: Whether an Institution offering MBA could be merged with an Institution offering Engineering Courses?
offering MBA could be merged with an Institution offering Engineering Courses?
responses: Yes, if both the Institutions are run by the same Trust/ Society/ Company.

patterns: We are an Autonomous Institution, want to apply for ME Programme in CSE (AI&ML) but this Programme is not offered by the affiliating university Anna University, Can AICTE permit us to start the Programme.
Can AICTE permit to start the Programme
responses: NO. It is mandatory to have University NOC plus 50% enrolment.

patterns: Can we open a new course within approved sanctioned intake without NBA?
new course within approved sanctioned intake without NBA?
responses: Yes, in Emerging area as per APH 2021-22

patterns: We want to reduce our B. Tech EEE course intake from 60 to 0.
We want to reduce our B. Tech EEE course
responses: Please apply on portal. Refer Appendix 17 APH 2021-22 for documents required to be submitted.

patterns: For Merger of Institution, who has to apply? Is it the Parent Institution or the Child Institution?
For Merger who has to apply?
responses: Parent Institution (Preferably).

patterns: Earlier Physics and mathematics were mandatory subjects in 10+2 level to take admission to Engineering. Are these subjects NOT mandatory from 2021-22?
Physics and mathematics were mandatory subjects in 10+2 level to take admission to Engineering
responses: Please refer the APH 2021-22. Concerned State Authorities / Universities will decide on the eligibility criteria for admission to Engineering courses. NOTE: Please read AICTE Press Release on this subject matter (Dated 12-03-2021)

patterns: Which Norms Architecture Colleges Should follow for   taking AICTE Approval (Notmentioned in APH 2020-21)?
Norms Architecture Colleges Should follow for   taking AICTE Approval
responses: Provision is made available on portal for the Existing Architecture Colleges / Institutes having valid COA approval (& willing to continue with AICTE) to apply for Extension of Approval. Similarly, new Architecture Institute seeking AICTE Approval should have valid approval of COA on the date of submission of application on AICTE Portal.

patterns: Will there be any decision on awarding Autonomy for Polytechnics?
responses: Under consideration by AICTE

patterns: Whether Institute can apply for three courses in Emerging Areas like Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, IOT, Cybersecurity etc.
Emerging Areas like Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, IOT, Cybersecurity
responses: Yes. If the institute have at least three valid NBA Accredited courses and fulfilling other conditions as mentioned in APH 2021-22.

patterns: Please specify the eligibility conditions for grant of approval for ODL / OL courses.
eligibility conditions for grant of approval for ODL / OL courses.
responses: Please refer Chapter-5 of APH 2021-22

patterns: Whether a Standalone Architecture Institution approved by Council of Architecture, can be merged with parent institution approved by AICTE.
responses: YES. If Architecture Institution is also having the approval of AICTE.

patterns: How can we apply for addition seats in Indian / Regional Languages at Diploma/Degree level Courses in Engineering and Technology?
How can we apply for addition seats Courses in Engineering and Technology?
responses: National Education Policy 2020 envisages the availability of Higher Technical Education in Indian / Regional Languages at Diploma/Degree level. AICTE shall permit an addition of ONE division with 30/60 seats to the eligible and interested institutes. Institutions seeking approval shall be permitted for Increase intake ONLY in Accredited courses.

patterns: Area of land on which AICTE HQ building has been constructed.
AICTE HQ building has been constructed.
responses: Five acres (20,179 Sq. mtr.)

patterns: What is the permissible/achieved FAR of the HQ building?
What is the achieved FAR of the HQ building?
What is the permissible FAR of the HQ building?
responses: The permissible FAR as per sanctioned building plan by the DDA was 120% and achieved FAR as per completion plan is 96.83%.

patterns: When was the completion certificate issued?
responses: Completion Certificate has been issued by South Delhi Municipal Corporation vide letter no. 09/CC/B-2/SZ/2016 dated 04.07.2016.

patterns: Permission/Approval of which agencies have been taken for construction of building?
Permission of which agencies have been taken for construction of building?
Approval of which agencies have been taken for construction of building?
responses: Permission/approval from Delhi Fire Service, DUAC, DPCC, Airport Authority of India was obtained.

patterns: What are the main features of AICTE HQ building?
What are the main features of AICTE building?
responses: AICTE HQ building has been constructed by DRDO. Besides Office block, Conference Rooms, Auditorium and Guest House, the building also has Sewage Treatment Plant and Water Harvesting System, Rooftop Solar Power unit of 140 KW + 30 KW, BMS, Central AC unit. Sufficient Green open area has also been provided in the building.

patterns: How the Guest House booking is done?
responses: Guest House booking is done through Bureau Heads of the AICTE and also through Regional Offices of AICTE based on requests for official meetings and visits by the Experts.
NEEM Scheme or the National Employability Enhancement Scheme as it is otherwise called is a joint initiative taken by the Government of India and All India Council for Technical Education ( AICTE).

patterns: Where to submit application for Registration as a NEEM Facilitator?
responses: The application for applying under NEEM Scheme is to be submitted by the applicant on the AICTE-Portal using the generated username and password provided to login to AICTE Portal.

patterns: Is there any registration fee for applying under NEEM?
registration fee for applying under NEEM?
responses: The Amount that needs to be paid for NEEM Facilitator Processing fee is 50,000. In addition to this fee of Rs. 5000/- is to be paid at the time of registration.

patterns: Processing fee is refundable or not?
responses: Processing fess is non-refundable subject to approval or dis-approval of the application of the applicant.

patterns: What is the eligibility criteria of a NEEM Facilitator?
eligibility criteria of a NEEM Facilitator
responses: The eligibility criteria for applying as a NEEM Facilitator is available at - https://www.aicte-india.org/downloads/NEEM%20REGULATION%202017.pdf#toolbar%20=%200

patterns: Provide the list of designated trades and industries for the purpose of training under NEEM Scheme ?
list of designated trades and industries for the purpose of training under NEEM Scheme
responses: List of courses offered under NEEM are available at - https://www.aicte-india.org/downloads/NEEM%20REGULATION%202017.pdf#toolbar%20=%200
NEEM training shall be for a minimum of 3 months and a maximum of 36 months and the trainings must be NSQF compliant.

patterns: Who will provide the training under NEEM ?
responses: NEEM training shall provide by a registered Company/Industry as registered with the NEEM Facilitator. Suitable MoU needs to be signed between the NEEM Facilitator & associated industry partner.

patterns: Is giving Aadhar number is mandatory?
responses: Yes. Except for states in North Eastern Region and Jammu & Kashmir State.

patterns: If a student enrolled for a course drops in between, can a new student be added?
can a new student be added in between?
responses: No. Editing of student`s data is not possible once training is started. Change of name of the student will also not be permitted.

patterns: Is any grant available for approved NEEM Facilitator?
grant available for approved NEEM Facilitator?
responses: No grant will be provided to the Facilitator under NEEM

patterns: Is any Stipend available for students?
responses: NEEM Facilitator shall pay all enrolled NEEM trainees a remuneration/stipend which shall be at par with the prescribed minimum wages for unskilled category and also the details are available at Clause 15.0 of NEEM Regulation, 2017.

patterns: Is there any certification after completion of training?
responses: Certificate to the beneficiaries will be provided by the respective NEEM Facilitator

patterns: Does NEEM Scheme and the exemptions under NEEM Scheme fall under the PF and ESI Act.
NEEM Scheme and the exemptions under NEEM Scheme fall under the PF and ESI Act
responses: PF and ESI authorities go by their Act which is Statutory and Supreme over all others. AICTE has written to PF Commissioner for exempting PF and ESI to NEEM trainees at par with Apprenticeship Act. The decision lies with office of the Commissioner. The outcome of the decision will be updated when received

patterns: Where to send the complaint regarding violation of AICTE norms and standards by the AICTE approved institutions.
complaint regarding violation of AICTE norms
complaint regarding violation of AICTE approved institutions.
responses: In this regard, if any person has any specific complaint against AICTE approved Institution regarding violation of norms and standards as prescribed in AICTE Approval Process Handbook. The complainant may send duly signed hard copy of the same alongwith supporting documents/evidence, if any, with complete postal address directly to Dy. Director, PGR Cell, AICTE Hqrs, Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi-110070.

patterns: How to make browser settings for AICTE Portal?
make browser settings for AICTE Portal
responses: Browser settings required for AICTE web portal are available in AICTE website. Following link can be referred for browser settings: http://www.aicte-india.org/downloads/Browser%20Settings%20for%20the%20institutes.pdf

patterns: I have forgotten password for logging in AICTE Web Portal. What is the procedure to recover this?
forgotten password for logging in AICTE
responses: Forgot password can be applied through AICTE Website. Click on 'Request for Forgot Password' in http://www.aicte-india.org/. Kindly fill User Id or Institute Permanent Id or any of the Application Ids and click on 'Submit Request'. Click on 'Click Here to Make Payment' and make Online Payment of Rs 5000. Within 48 hours new password will be mailed to the e-mail id registered with AICTE web portal. No other web page should be opened while applying for forgot password.

patterns: Is PAN No. field is mandatory for 'Forgot Password' form?
PAN No. mandatory for 'Forgot Password' form?
responses: No, PAN Card is not mandatory. Only User Id or any one of the Application Ids is required

patterns: How to import student details, faculty details excel file?
import student details, faculty details excel file?
responses: Check the required browser settings and instructions as listed in following link http://www.aicte-india.org/downloads/generalinstructionsforfillingfacultyexcelsheet.pdf

patterns: I have made Online Payment but amount is not updated in portal?
Online Payment amount is not updated in portal?
responses: Payment is updated within 48 hours (2 working days). In case it is not updated even after that, please send details of the transaction (Transaction Id generated while making the payment) and application to AICTE helpdesk

patterns: I am not able to Edit/Delete wrong attachment in PG Scholarship Step 3?
I am not able to Delete wrong attachment in PG Scholarship?
I am not able to Edit wrong attachment in PG Scholarship?
responses: Edit/Delete facility is not given. But new attachment can be uploaded. The latest uploaded document will be considered for further processing of the scholarship.

patterns: How to Approve or Disapprove PG student in Institute Login?
Approve or Disapprove PG student in Institiute Login
responses: Following document can be referred http://www.aicte-india.org/downloads/User_Manual_of_PG_Scholarship_for_Institutions_12_11_2013.pdf

patterns: How to delete student record from student details tab.
responses: Student record cannot be deleted. Student can be marked as Duplicate or Left the Institute in 'Student Details' tab.

patterns: In which format should I upload my docs for PG Scholarship?
format to upload my docs for PG Scholarship?
responses: All documents should be uploaded in pdf format only.

patterns: Can I Edit Bank Details in AQIS after confirming Bank Details?
Edit Bank Details in AQIS after confirming Bank Details?
responses: Yes. Click on 'Edit Bank Details' button. The fields will be become editable. After editing click on save and confirm buttons.

patterns: How to get Student Id and Institute Id for applying PG Scholarship?
How to get Student Id and Institute Id?
responses: Navigate to following link: http://www.aicte-india.org/PGScholarship.php To obtain Institute Id- Click on 'Get Institute ID', to open the pdf of 'List of AICTE approved institutions' To obtain Student Id- Click on 'Get PG Student Id', enter the required details and click on 'Get Student Id'

patterns: When I try to submit PG Scholarship application in Step 3, I get an error regarding duplicity of E-mail address, Contact No., Aadhar Number.
error regarding duplicity of E-mail address, Contact No., Aadhar Number.
responses: Only one application should be created and forwarded for processing. Please check whether any other application exists for the particular student. In case more than one application exists, Institute should mark Student as a duplicate student in 'Student Details' tab. Contact AICTE helpdesk with the Student Id in case the issue still persists.

patterns: Verification awaited by institute status is coming in Status set by institute field at PG Scholarship Step 3. What should I do?
Verification awaited by institute status is coming in Status set by institute field at PG Scholarship. What should I do?
Verification awaited by institute status is coming in Status set by institute field at PG Scholarship
responses: Institute has not verified the details. Contact institute.

patterns: I have filled registration form for J&K renewal Scholarship. But I did not receive user id and password.
filled registration form for J&K renewal Scholarship
responses: Check the inbox and spam mails of e-mail id which was entered during registration. In case user id and password is not received, contact J&K Cell.

patterns: How should I apply for PG scholarship in case I have changed my Institution?
responses: The student should be marked as 'Left the Institute' by the Institute as detailed in http://www.aicte-india.org/downloads/User_Manual_of_PG_Scholarship_for_Institutions_12_11_2013.pdf. Then Student should login in PG Scholarship Step 3 and enter the details of new institute. The new institute should login with their credentials in AICTE web portal and approve the student. Thereafter, normal procedure is followed.

A digital signature is an electronic form of a signature that can be used to authenticate the identity of the sender of a message or the signer of a document, and also ensure that the original content of the message or document that has been sent is unchanged. Digital signatures are easily transportable and cannot be imitated by someone else. The ability to ensure that the original signed message arrived means that the sender cannot easily disclaim it later.

patterns: What is a Digital Signature Certificate?
responses: Digital Signature Certificates (DSC) is the electronic format of physical or paper certificate like a driving License, passport etc. Certificates serve as proof of identity of an individual for a certain purpose; for example, a Passport identifies someone as a citizen of that country; who can legally travel to any country. Likewise, a Digital Signature Certificate can be presented electronically to prove your identity, to access information or services on the Internet or to sign certain documents digitally.

patterns: Why do I need Digital Signature Certificate?
responses: A Digital Signature Certificate authenticates your identity electronically. It also provides you with a high level of security for your online transactions by ensuring absolute privacy of the information exchanged using a Digital Signature Certificate. You can use certificates to encrypt information such that only the intended recipient can read it. You can digitally sign information to assure the recipient that it has not been changed in transit, and also verify your identity as the sender of the message.

patterns: Where can I purchase a Digital Signature Certificate?
responses: Legally valid Digital Signature Certificates are issued only through a Controller of Certifying  Authorities (CCA), Govt. of India, licensed Certifying Authorities (CA)

patterns: Can Digital Signature Certificates can be used in wireless networks?
Digital Signature Certificates used in wireless networks?
responses: Yes, digital signature certificates can be employed in wireless networks.

patterns: How long will it take for the application to be processed?
responses: DSC issuance would require 5 business days from the date of applying/application.

patterns: I have forgotten my private key password. Can someone change it for me?
I have forgotten my private key password?
responses: No. If you have forgotten your private key password, you will have to apply for a new Digital Signature Certificate

patterns: What is the eligibility criteria of any Institution for applying under Vocational courses?
eligibility criteria of any Institution for applying under Vocational courses?
eligibility criteria for applying under Vocational courses
responses: Only AICTE approved Institutions are eligible to apply. Institution willing to run these Courses should have AICTE approval in relevant area.

patterns: Where to submit application for Vocational courses?
responses: The application is to be submitted by the Institutions on the AICTE-Portal using username and password provided to login to AICTE Portal

patterns: Who will do the assessment and certification?
responses: University/Board will conduct examination for Education Component. SKP/Training Provider will do assessment for skill competency.

SWAYAM (Study Webs of Active-learning for Young Aspiring Minds); India Chapter of Massive Open Online Courses. SWAYAM is an indigenous developed IT platform, initiated by Government of India, which is instrumental for self-actualisation providing opportunities or a life-long learning.

patterns: For which standard & discipline, the Courses shall be delivered through SWAYAM?
Courses shall be delivered through SWAYAM?
responses: The SWAYAM shall facilitate hosting of all the  courses, taught in classrooms from 9th class  till post-graduation and hundreds of courses  covering virtually every course that is taught  at the university/college/school level and  these shall be offered by best of the teachers  in India. The curriculum based course contents shall also cover diverse disciplines such as arts, science, commerce, performing arts, social sciences and humanities subjects, engineering, technology, law, medicine agriculture etc. in higher education domain (all courses would be certification-ready in their detailed offering)

patterns: Can any person in the world register a Course on SWAYAM?
Can any person register a Course on SWAYAM?
responses: Yes, any person in the world can register a Course on SWAYAM

patterns: Do I need a dedicated internet connection? or I can consume course contents offline once logged in?
responses: You would need an active internet connection to consume course contents.

patterns: Can I also download my content for offline access?
responses: Yes provided faculty has given the download access to the students.

patterns: How can a learner keep track of the assignments?
responses: The learners have a separate assignment details page within the course from which they can access all assignments and see pertinent data such as due date, date submitted, maximum marks, marks obtained,  and grade obtained.

patterns: Do I need to mark my attendance for live classes?
responses: Your attendance will be marked automatically.

patterns: Can I cancel a grievance I submitted?
responses: Yes, you can. Just visit your grievances page, select the grievance you want to cancel, and you will see the option to cancel it. Grievance that have already been addressed cannot be cancelled.

patterns: Is there a mechanism for me to submit a grievance I might have?
responses: Yes. After logging onto your learner account in Swayam, you can click on the “Grievances”

patterns: How can a learner play the closed caption while watching the video?
closed caption while watching the video?
responses: Learner will see the CC option once they play the video, and can choose the language of their choice.

patterns: Can a learner switch between an open discussion and a group discussion of his own?
responses: Yes, Learner has the privilege to switch between the open and group discussion, provided that learner is a part of specific group discussion, otherwise learner will only be able to send messages in an open discussion.

patterns: What will happen if the learner tries to access the courseware without submitting the survey?
access the courseware without submitting the surve
responses: The system will redirect the learner to fill & complete the survey form first.

patterns: Can I submit my assignments online?
responses: Yes, It can be done!

patterns: When can I enroll into the course?
responses: You can enrol in a self-paced course at any time of your choosing. Scheduled courses support student enrolment from 60 days  before the course is scheduled to start

patterns: Can I enroll into multiple courses once I got myself registered with Swayam portal?
multiple courses registered with Swayam portal?
responses: Yes, you can enroll in multiple course (MOOCs) on Swayam after registration

patterns: Do we need Research Laboratory for each PG Course?
need Research Laboratory for each PG
responses: No. Research Laboratory is to be provided for each Institution offering Post Graduate Courses.
E-affidavit is preferable NOT mandatory.
